JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Volodymyr Butkevych;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . She was represented before the Court by PERSON , a lawyer practising in PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agents , PERSON and Mr PERSON , from ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant brought a car registered in GPE ( a DATE ORG ) into the customs territory of GPE . When crossing the border she undertook an obligation to re - export the car before DATE . She failed to do so , however .
On DATE the applicant , upon request of the customs authorities , explained that the car had been brought to GPE and sold to unknown persons .
On DATE she explained that she did not bring the car to GPE but left it on the NORP - NORP border .

On DATE ORG , in absence of records confirming that the impugned car had actually left GPE , drew up a report on an infringement of customs regulations due to the applicant ’s failure to remove the above car from the customs territory of GPE ( LAW ) .

On DATE ORG submitted the above report to ORG of PERSON . Before the court the applicant explained that she had brought the car to the checkpoint on the Ukrainian- NORP border and then her husband had been supposed to take it away to GPE . The applicant ’s husband explained that he had sold a car on the border check - point to an unknown person . ORG explained that the car was not registered as exiting GPE at the period mentioned by the applicant .

On DATE the court found the applicant guilty of having failed to re - export the car in violation of LAW . The court ordered the confiscation of the vehicle , but given that the car ’s location was unknown , it replaced the confiscation with payment of CARDINAL NORP hryvynas ( ORG ) ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) , which corresponded to the value of the car , in accordance with LAW of LAW .
On DATE the Acting President of ORG refused the applicant ’s request to initiate supervisory review proceedings in the case .
The relevant domestic law is summarised in the case of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE . )
